meanings.definition: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
meanings.sent1: She was meticulous in her painting, making sure every brushstroke was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The architect's meticulous planning ensured that every room in the house was well-designed.
meanings.sent3: The chef was so meticulous in plating the dish that it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous handwriting resembled calligraphy, each letter perfectly formed.
meanings.sent5: The detective's meticulous investigation uncovered every clue, leading to the culprit's arrest.

meanings.definition: Taking or showing extreme care about minute details; precise; thorough.
meanings.sent1: The tailor was meticulous in measuring the fabric to ensure a perfect fit.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's meticulous experiments left no room for error in the results.
meanings.sent3: The student was so meticulous in organizing her notes that she never lost track of any information.
meanings.sent4: The gardener's meticulous pruning of the bushes transformed the garden into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The watchmaker's meticulous craftsmanship was evident in the intricate design of the timepiece.
